main event: A civilian pilot and witnesses spotted a cigar-shaped unidentified aerial object in Jackson, Mississippi on January 1, 1949.
interesting points: The object was first thought to be a large tow target with a length of about 60 feet and a width of 10 feet., The pilot included his wife in the observation, and both confirmed its unusual shape, with no wings observed., The object was reported to have traveled at speeds ranging from 200 mph to potentially 600 mph., Witnesses reported the object emitted a sound similar to that of a helicopter., The object's sighting lasted approximately 10 to 12 seconds before it accelerated and disappeared from view.
witness description: a civilian pilot and his wife along with another couple
